CatDescriptText: Article accompanying related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 13, 1964, pg. 6, reads: "Home Rites Unite Pair. During a recent wedding, charming nary Louise Clark, became the bride of Arthur Burns Jr.  The nuptials tool place at the residence of the bride's parents, the Rev. W. R. Shields and the late Mrs. Buelah [sic] Shields.  For her marriage, the bride wore a dress of blue silk georgette.  Her blue satin chapeau was a Glo Miller creation.  Mrs. Willa Lewis, sister of the bride, was matron of honor.  The groom's brother, William Burns, was best man and the Rev. C. Leroy Hacker officiated at the rites.  An informal reception followed the rites at the Greene Hearthe [sic].  The groom is national sales manager for the Crayton Southern Sausage Co."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of two men, including groom Arthur Burns Jr. wearing grid patterned suit, and two women, including bride Mary Louise Clark Burns wearing light blue silk georgette dress and satin pillbox hat with veil, standing in home of bride's parents, Rev. W. R. and Beulah Shields
